intro: Brachymeris athanasioides, commonly known as the Ethiopian threadtail, is a species of damselfly belonging to the family Coenagrionidae. It is characterized by its slender body and elongated wings, typical of many damselfly species. This species is native to Africa, particularly found in regions such as Ethiopia and Sudan. Brachymeris athanasioides typically inhabits freshwater environments like streams and ponds with dense vegetation. Its life cycle involves aquatic larval stages followed by emergence as adults, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
